data.name: Crimson Dawn
data.detailed_description:
Crimson Dawn is a casual hack & slash RPG. Recruit and train mercenaries and deploy them to regions that have been captured by the evil Crimson Dawn. Carve a path to the Crimson Oracle and put a stop to this madness once and for all!

Features:

  • A hack & slash RPG that won't break your mouse or give you carpal tunnel syndrome
  • Relaxing, satisfying gameplay
  • Lots of room to level up your mercenaries and upgrade their weapons and spells
  • Varied locations, each with its own monsters and quests to choose from
  • Every weapon and spell has its own unique game mechanic
  • Lots of achievements to unlock

Purge the land of the Crimson Dawn's hordes

Crimson Dawn is a casual hack & slash RPG. Recruit and train mercenaries for battle. Upgrade them from novice adventurers with flimsy gear to terrifying combat veterans with a massive arsenal. Go on an epic journey from your backwater village to the very source of the invading evil. Reach the Crimson Oracle and put a stop to this madness once and for all!

Hack and slash without a single click!

Every weapon and spell attacks automatically, so all you have to do is steer clear of enemies and try not to get surrounded. So sit back, relax, and crush hordes of fiendish foes without breaking a sweat!

Freedom of choice

You decide how many quests you want to take on and what you're willing to risk. More quests means stronger monsters — or maybe even bosses — but also better loot.

Open-ended character development

Your mercenaries earn experience for every successful run. Earn enough XP, and you'll get a skill point you can use to enhance their combat abilities.


Every weapon and spell has its own upgrade tree, as well as its own game mechanics.
Your character gathers materials and coins during battle. You can use them to upgrade weapons and spells and enhance skills that are shared by all characters.

Crimson Madness

During battle, your mercenaries are vulnerable to the influence of the Crimson Dawn. Every time they damage an enemy, their Crimson Madness level increases. This makes them more powerful, but also affects their sanity. The more enemies you defeat, the longer your mercenary will need to recover in town.
